author: Megan Levy
title: Sydney weather: rain offers respite, before another baking weekend
text:
Flash choir in Sydney Flash choir in Sydney 
The City Recital Hall is holding its first Sydney Flash Mob Choir. It's an impromptu gathering of hundreds of people for a spontaneous sing-along, led by esteemed conductor Richard Gill. More videos Swap the sunscreen for brollies 
Wet and cloudy weather on Tuesday and Wednesday will give Sydney a short break from the heat before the temperatures quickly rise again at the weekend. 
The mercury on Tuesday is forecast to reach a top of just 25 degrees in the city and in the west. That is on par with the long-term maximum February average for the city, and below average for places like Penrith, where the long-term maximum is 29.3 degrees. 
Wednesday is expected to hit a top of 26 degrees in the city and 27 degrees in the west, before temperatures start to climb again for a scorching end to the week. Related Content Sydney heat could break century-old record, before cool change hits 
Weatherzone meteorologist Rob Sharpe said storms south of Sydney were moving along a low-pressure trough that was slowly edging north. 
"There will be periods of rain with the chance of some lightning later [on Tuesday] morning in Sydney," Mr Sharpe said. Advertisement 
The rain should ease in the afternoon, Mr Sharpe said, before heavier falls start in Sydney later on Tuesday night when an upper upper level trough moves in. 
"I would expect the heaviest falls are going to be near the coast and the lightest falls in the west," Mr Sharpe said. 
"We could see beyond 50 millimetres for some coastal areas." The city only received 48.4 millimetres of rain throughout all of January, Bureau of Meteorology figures show. Weatherzone: Sydney radar 
While day-time maximum temperatures will be milder in the next two days, nights will continue to be significantly warmer than average. 
A minimum of 22 degrees is forecast in the city until Thursday, before rising to 24 degrees on Friday and Saturday nights. That is well above the mean minimum temperature for February of 18.8 degrees. 
Nights in Sydney's west will be cooler than the city, dipping to 20 degrees on Wednesday night, and 21 degrees on Thursday night. 
Sydney will again be baking by Friday, when the mercury is expected to hit a top of 42 degrees in Penrith, rising to 43 degrees on Saturday and 42 degrees on Sunday. 
The city is expected to reach a high of 35 degrees from Friday through to Sunday.
